snippet: In a long-running feud, a jury awarded Fresh Del Monte $13.15 million, saying Del Monte Foods violated licensing agreements by selling cut, refrigerated fruit products.
abstract: Federal jury in Manhattan rules that Del Monte Foods misled consumers with the labeling on some of its cut, refrigerated fruit products and violated the terms of licensing agreements it has with Fresh Del Monte, the fresh fruit and vegetable company that was split off in 1989; jury awards Fresh Del Monte $13.15 million.
lead_paragraph: In a long-running feud, a jury awarded Fresh Del Monte $13.15 million, saying Del Monte Foods violated licensing agreements by selling cut, refrigerated fruit products.

headline.seo: Fresh Del Monte Awarded Damages in Fruit Dispute
headline.main: Jury Awards Damages in Fruit Fight
headline.print_headline: Jury Awards Damages In Fruit Fight
